709673f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue, west side, from 16th to 15th Streets, showing new apartment house at 200 West 16th Street nearing completion.
February 28, 1930.
Charles Curtis.
[handwritten]:
NEG 4330

709672f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue at N.E. corner of 15th Street, across excavation at
S.W. corner, showing Street and Smith Building.
February 28, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

711336f-b.text:
(1)
St. Joseph's Home for the Aged, 15th Street adjoining N.W. corner of Seventh Avenue. This institution, which opened in 1873 is maintained by the Society of St. Vincent De Paul. (Roman Catholic).
February 28, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
A closer view of the entrance.
May 30, 1929.
P.L. Sperr.

711336f-a.text:
(1)
St. Joseph's Home for the Aged, 15th Street adjoining N.W. corner of Seventh Avenue. This institution, which opened in 1873 is maintained by the Society of St. Vincent De Paul. (Roman Catholic).
February 28, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
A closer view of the entrance.
May 30, 1929.
P.L. Sperr.

711337f-a.text:
15th Street at N.W. corner of Seventh Avenue, and west to the middle of the block. St. Joseph's Home for the aged (1873), which is maintained by the Society of St. Vincent De Paul, adjoins the corner.
The construction work on the S.W. corner of Seventh Avenue is for a new apartment house.
1931
P.L. Sperr.

[handwritten, at bottom]:
New Apt. - 6 story - Arch draw.  Herald Tribune 1/21/40
